title: Find where two different series both converge

content.question: For what values of p will both series <math> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <munderover> <mo>∑</mo> <mrow> <mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow> <mi>∞</mi> </munderover> <mrow> <mfrac> <mn>1</mn> <mrow> <msup> <mi>n</mi> <mrow> <mn>2</mn><mi>p</mi></mrow> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> </mstyle></mrow> </math> and <math> <mrow> <mstyle displaystyle="true"> <munderover> <mo>∑</mo> <mrow> <mi>n</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>1</mn></mrow> <mi>∞</mi> </munderover> <mrow> <msup> <mrow> <mrow><mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mfrac> <mi>p</mi> <mn>2</mn> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow> <mi>n</mi> </msup> </mrow> </mstyle></mrow> </math> converges?

choices.label: There are no such values of p.

skill.text: Skill 3.B: Identify an appropriate mathematical definition, theorem, or test to apply.
